critique: This document is a treaty between the US and Mexico regarding the recovery of stolen vehicles and aircraft. It establishes a process for the return of such items and outlines the required documentation. It does not touch upon typical ideological debates, immigration policies, executive power, or economic regulation. It has a slight impact on federalism by establishing a cooperative agreement between the two countries. It also has a slight impact on national security by facilitating the recovery of stolen property. There is no discernible impact on social inclusion.
